duties_responsibilities.duty: Prepare work papers to support the Firm's U.S. and international tax filings.
Assist with special projects relating to the taxes of the Firm.
Compile and analyze financial data for the preparation of the Firm's U.S. and international tax returns.
Provide technical analysis and applications of U.S. and domestic partnership tax rules.
Keep abreast of relevant tax law developments and changes.
Develop an expert working knowledge of the Firm's general ledger system to analyze, compile, and reconcile data.
Assist with quarterly domestic and international tax filings, partner memorandums, and various reports using Excel spreadsheets and the Partner Accounting System.
Analyze and verify partner taxes paid/withheld as well as partner allocations.
Prepare quarterly tax withholdings, composite, local entity level tax, and filings as well as assist with quarterly Partner memoranda.
Demonstrate effective interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills to facilitate effective work relationships with others.
Comply with and understand Firm operation, policies and procedures.
Perform other related duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Accounting (additional certifications may be preferred)
